summary: You’re My Bodyguard, Not My Owner. (Chapter 23) (Brendon Urie x Reader)
title: You’re My Bodyguard, Not My Owner. (Chapter 23) (Brendon Urie x Reader)
body:
You had thought that Brendon’s cold, hard stare was the most intimidatingly unnerving one you had ever been on the receiving end of, but it was nothing compared to that of The Director.

Sitting on an uncomfortably stiff leather chair in his cube glass office, you felt as if you were back in middle school, called into the principal’s office for doing something wrong. Which, when you made a comparison, wasn’t too far off from the actual scenario you were currently immersed in.

As soon as you had arrived back at HQ an hour ago, after having taken a shower and settled a bit, you had been summoned to The Director’s office, where you had been instructed to take a seat alongside Brendon. Timidly, you slunk into the hard chair, shifting awkwardly under The Director’s piercing gaze. You snuck a glance at Brendon and even though the both of you knew you were about to receive a talking-to that would make you want to crawl into the deepest, darkest corner of the earth and never come out, your bodyguard looked as calm and collected as ever – jaw taut and radiating coolness and confidence just like he had the first time you saw him.

Tearing your gaze away from the block of ice sitting next to you, you chanced a look in The Director’s direction. He was sitting behind his desk, resting his elbows on it as he steepled his fingers and cast an iron glare on your blanching face. You felt as if he was boring a hole through you and staring into your soul, and you gulped down what minuscule amount of saliva that was left in your mouth.

The scene stayed like this for the better part of an hour; The Director’s gaze never wavered, and neither you nor Brendon dared to move or say anything, even though you were dying to alleviate the daunting silence and tense atmosphere that had fallen over the glass room.

The Director had a way of using his steely gaze to play with your head in such a way that after only a few minutes under his penetrative stare, you were silently praying that he would yell or toss things around in anger, rather than just torturing you with silence. But he was perfectly aware of what he was doing, and he continued with his form of silent torture for as long as he deemed necessary. Which, apparently, was fifty-three minutes and thirty-seven seconds.

When he did finally break the silence, he spoke slowly and deliberately and kept his tone neutral, so that what he was saying would resound clearly in your and Brendon’s heads.

“What, pray tell,” he started, looking from you to Brendon, “were you thinking?”

You didn’t respond at first, and neither did your bodyguard, but when the superior began tapping his index fingers together as if to say I’m waiting, you let out a short sigh and straightened up in your seat. Opening your mouth, you were about to try account for the clear violation of rules that had occurred, but your bodyguard beat you to the punch.

“I was thinking that since (Y/N) has been holed up in this place for the past few months, it would be good for her to get out for a little while,” Brendon said smoothly, the words that held so much trouble spilling from his lips without so much as a hint of reluctance, “And what better day to do it on than her birthday?”

The Director raised an eyebrow at his agent. “Is that so?” he muttered, “And, tell me, Agent Urie,” he continued, voice clearer now as he steadied his gaze on the office door behind you two, “this plan of yours – the one you amassed to take (Y/N) out tonight… did you think it through?”

“I thought that I had, sir,” he answered, voice unwavering despite the challenge of authority he was facing; you were gobsmacked by his lack of concern, “but unfortunately I was wrong.”

“Hmph,” came the reply. After a moment of no words being spoken, The Director stood up and made his way around the desk to the front before he proceeded to lean back against it, eyes once again darting from you to Brendon. “I could have lost you tonight,” he said softly, allowing his facial features to soften for a minute, “I could have lost both of you. And why? All because of some stupid ass decision that you made, Agent,” he spat, pointing an accusatory finger at Brendon, who simply clenched his jaw in response.

“I expected better from you, Urie, I really did,” The Director spoke, rubbing a hand over and around his mouth, “You of all people know how dangerous of a feat tonight was. You knew how great of a possibility there was that something bad would happen. You knew that she,” he darted his eyes to you, “could have died. Or worse – captured by Hydra. Now, for someone who is supposed to be protecting her at all costs, you tell me,” he leaned in closer to Brendon, “do you think that the stunt you pulled tonight was a good move?”

“No, sir,” Brendon replied. You noticed that his grip on the edge of the chair’s armrest had tightened.

“Then why the hell did you do it?”

“He was just trying to do something nice,” you interjected, causing Brendon to turn and look at you. The Director, on the other hand, kept his eyes locked on Brendon, not even bothering to glimpse at you.

“Something nice that could’ve cost you your life,” he countered, making Brendon turn to face him again.

“What couldn’t cost me my life?” you huffed, rolling your eyes, “From the very first moment I set foot in this hellhole, I’ve been on lockdown. I felt like a prisoner, not able to go anywhere, do anything, see anyone… it was driving me insane. So Brendon, unlike everyone else around here, decided to do something about it. And it was the best I’ve felt in a long time, so yes, it wasn’t the smartest of moves, but it definitely wasn’t the dumbest of ones either,” you hissed, glaring at your dad’s oldest friend. You thought you caught sight of Brendon’s lips curve into a smirk, but you couldn’t be sure.

“His job is not to take pity on you,” The Director stated, returning your unfriendly glare, “His job is to protect you. And by the looks of it, he hasn’t quite been so strict in adhering to what the job entails. I trusted that he was the best fit for the job, but now I’m not so sure. Maybe I should reappoint you a new bodyguard.”

With a scoff, you stood up from your seat. “Like hell you are!”

“Excuse me?”

“You heard me,” you sassed, anger boiling up inside of you, shocking both men with your assertiveness, “Brendon is literally the only reason I’m still alive right now; he’s never failed to protect me. Not once. He’s also a better agent than all of the rest of SHIELD combined, and we all know it. You are not reappointing me a bodyguard. He stays. Or so help me God, I will turn myself in to Hydra.”

At first, both of them just stared at you, no doubt in shock over your sudden outburst. Eventually, The Director gave a slow nod, and you were certain that you caught a smirk from Brendon this time around.

“Alright then,” The Director said, still nodding, “Brendon stays.”

You smiled triumphantly. “So, are we free to leave, now?”

“You are, yes. I need to speak with Brendon.”

Ignoring the suspiciousness of the situation, you headed for the door, brushing it off as just The Director wanting to reprimand him some more. Sighing, you walked down the hallway to your room.

~

“So much feistiness for such a tiny person,” Brendon remarked, referring to your outburst in The Director’s office as he leaned against the doorframe of your room, not at all looking like someone who undoubtedly just got yelled at.

“I am not tiny,” you defended, closing the book you were reading and tossing it back onto the pile at the foot of your bed.

“Sure,” he crossed over to take a seat next to you, “tiny.”

“Yeah, well, this tiny person just saved your job so…” you pointed out, tossing him a smug look as you brought crossed your legs on the bed, “Even though I know that you were probably aching to get rid of me. But I live to bring you misery,” you cheeked.

Brendon’s face turned serious. “(Y/N),” he frowned, and you tilted your head to the side in confusion. He studied your face for a while before whispering. “You know that I’d die before I’d let anything happen to you, right? And I’d never, ever do anything to purposefully put you in danger.”

You felt a lump form in your throat that wouldn’t go away no matter how many times you swallowed. Your bodyguard was looking at you earnestly, and you stared back with a blank face, caught off guard by what he’d just said. It was unlike him to show so much emotion in one night. Or even one month, for that matter.

“Yeah,” you whispered, nodding, “Yeah, I know.”

“Good,” he nodded, looking at you the same way he had earlier, in the office. Which reminded you…

“Brendon?” you furrowed your brow.

“Mm?”

“What did Fury want to speak to you about?”

Instead of replying, he lifted his hand and brought it to your face, gently cupping it. “It’s been a long day,” he said, “Get some rest. I’ll see you in the morning.”

___________________________________________________________________________

Thank you for reading x

You had thought that Brendon’s cold, hard stare was the most intimidatingly unnerving one you had ever been on the receiving end of, but it was nothing compared to that of The Director.

Sitting on an uncomfortably stiff leather chair in his cube glass office, you felt as if you were back in middle school, called into the principal’s office for doing something wrong. Which, when you made a comparison, wasn’t too far off from the actual scenario you were currently immersed in.

As soon as you had arrived back at HQ an hour ago, after having taken a shower and settled a bit, you had been summoned to The Director’s office, where you had been instructed to take a seat alongside Brendon. Timidly, you slunk into the hard chair, shifting awkwardly under The Director’s piercing gaze. You snuck a glance at Brendon and even though the both of you knew you were about to receive a talking-to that would make you want to crawl into the deepest, darkest corner of the earth and never come out, your bodyguard looked as calm and collected as ever – jaw taut and radiating coolness and confidence just like he had the first time you saw him.

Tearing your gaze away from the block of ice sitting next to you, you chanced a look in The Director’s direction. He was sitting behind his desk, resting his elbows on it as he steepled his fingers and cast an iron glare on your blanching face. You felt as if he was boring a hole through you and staring into your soul, and you gulped down what minuscule amount of saliva that was left in your mouth.

The scene stayed like this for the better part of an hour; The Director’s gaze never wavered, and neither you nor Brendon dared to move or say anything, even though you were dying to alleviate the daunting silence and tense atmosphere that had fallen over the glass room.

The Director had a way of using his steely gaze to play with your head in such a way that after only a few minutes under his penetrative stare, you were silently praying that he would yell or toss things around in anger, rather than just torturing you with silence. But he was perfectly aware of what he was doing, and he continued with his form of silent torture for as long as he deemed necessary. Which, apparently, was fifty-three minutes and thirty-seven seconds.

When he did finally break the silence, he spoke slowly and deliberately and kept his tone neutral, so that what he was saying would resound clearly in your and Brendon’s heads.

“What, pray tell,” he started, looking from you to Brendon, “were you thinking?”

You didn’t respond at first, and neither did your bodyguard, but when the superior began tapping his index fingers together as if to say I’m waiting, you let out a short sigh and straightened up in your seat. Opening your mouth, you were about to try account for the clear violation of rules that had occurred, but your bodyguard beat you to the punch.

“I was thinking that since (Y/N) has been holed up in this place for the past few months, it would be good for her to get out for a little while,” Brendon said smoothly, the words that held so much trouble spilling from his lips without so much as a hint of reluctance, “And what better day to do it on than her birthday?”

The Director raised an eyebrow at his agent. “Is that so?” he muttered, “And, tell me, Agent Urie,” he continued, voice clearer now as he steadied his gaze on the office door behind you two, “this plan of yours – the one you amassed to take (Y/N) out tonight… did you think it through?”

“I thought that I had, sir,” he answered, voice unwavering despite the challenge of authority he was facing; you were gobsmacked by his lack of concern, “but unfortunately I was wrong.”

“Hmph,” came the reply. After a moment of no words being spoken, The Director stood up and made his way around the desk to the front before he proceeded to lean back against it, eyes once again darting from you to Brendon. “I could have lost you tonight,” he said softly, allowing his facial features to soften for a minute, “I could have lost both of you. And why? All because of some stupid ass decision that you made, Agent,” he spat, pointing an accusatory finger at Brendon, who simply clenched his jaw in response.

“I expected better from you, Urie, I really did,” The Director spoke, rubbing a hand over and around his mouth, “You of all people know how dangerous of a feat tonight was. You knew how great of a possibility there was that something bad would happen. You knew that she,” he darted his eyes to you, “could have died. Or worse – captured by Hydra. Now, for someone who is supposed to be protecting her at all costs, you tell me,” he leaned in closer to Brendon, “do you think that the stunt you pulled tonight was a good move?”

“No, sir,” Brendon replied. You noticed that his grip on the edge of the chair’s armrest had tightened.

“Then why the hell did you do it?”

“He was just trying to do something nice,” you interjected, causing Brendon to turn and look at you. The Director, on the other hand, kept his eyes locked on Brendon, not even bothering to glimpse at you.

“Something nice that could’ve cost you your life,” he countered, making Brendon turn to face him again.

“What couldn’t cost me my life?” you huffed, rolling your eyes, “From the very first moment I set foot in this hellhole, I’ve been on lockdown. I felt like a prisoner, not able to go anywhere, do anything, see anyone… it was driving me insane. So Brendon, unlike everyone else around here, decided to do something about it. And it was the best I’ve felt in a long time, so yes, it wasn’t the smartest of moves, but it definitely wasn’t the dumbest of ones either,” you hissed, glaring at your dad’s oldest friend. You thought you caught sight of Brendon’s lips curve into a smirk, but you couldn’t be sure.

“His job is not to take pity on you,” The Director stated, returning your unfriendly glare, “His job is to protect you. And by the looks of it, he hasn’t quite been so strict in adhering to what the job entails. I trusted that he was the best fit for the job, but now I’m not so sure. Maybe I should reappoint you a new bodyguard.”

With a scoff, you stood up from your seat. “Like hell you are!”

“Excuse me?”

“You heard me,” you sassed, anger boiling up inside of you, shocking both men with your assertiveness, “Brendon is literally the only reason I’m still alive right now; he’s never failed to protect me. Not once. He’s also a better agent than all of the rest of SHIELD combined, and we all know it. You are not reappointing me a bodyguard. He stays. Or so help me God, I will turn myself in to Hydra.”

At first, both of them just stared at you, no doubt in shock over your sudden outburst. Eventually, The Director gave a slow nod, and you were certain that you caught a smirk from Brendon this time around.

“Alright then,” The Director said, still nodding, “Brendon stays.”

You smiled triumphantly. “So, are we free to leave, now?”

“You are, yes. I need to speak with Brendon.”

Ignoring the suspiciousness of the situation, you headed for the door, brushing it off as just The Director wanting to reprimand him some more. Sighing, you walked down the hallway to your room.

~

“So much feistiness for such a tiny person,” Brendon remarked, referring to your outburst in The Director’s office as he leaned against the doorframe of your room, not at all looking like someone who undoubtedly just got yelled at.

“I am not tiny,” you defended, closing the book you were reading and tossing it back onto the pile at the foot of your bed.

“Sure,” he crossed over to take a seat next to you, “tiny.”

“Yeah, well, this tiny person just saved your job so…” you pointed out, tossing him a smug look as you brought crossed your legs on the bed, “Even though I know that you were probably aching to get rid of me. But I live to bring you misery,” you cheeked.

Brendon’s face turned serious. “(Y/N),” he frowned, and you tilted your head to the side in confusion. He studied your face for a while before whispering. “You know that I’d die before I’d let anything happen to you, right? And I’d never, ever do anything to purposefully put you in danger.”

You felt a lump form in your throat that wouldn’t go away no matter how many times you swallowed. Your bodyguard was looking at you earnestly, and you stared back with a blank face, caught off guard by what he’d just said. It was unlike him to show so much emotion in one night. Or even one month, for that matter.

“Yeah,” you whispered, nodding, “Yeah, I know.”

“Good,” he nodded, looking at you the same way he had earlier, in the office. Which reminded you…

“Brendon?” you furrowed your brow.

“Mm?”

“What did Fury want to speak to you about?”

Instead of replying, he lifted his hand and brought it to your face, gently cupping it. “It’s been a long day,” he said, “Get some rest. I’ll see you in the morning.”

___________________________________________________________________________

Thank you for reading x

title: Count Your Blessings 8
body:
Pairing: Steve Rogers x Reader

Warnings: Language. Lies. Friends with Benefits. Possessiveness. Fights. Kidnapping. Small amount of violence.

   He left to find himself. Too young and dumb to stay and stick through it.
He took your happiness with, but left you something.
   The little girl you were growing.
He doesn’t know and you weren’t in a hurry to track down the man who broke your heart.
   You don’t need him.
Still don’t. The two of you are just fine.
That’s what you keep telling yourself, at least.
Till Steve Rogers comes barging back into your life.
Everything comes rushing back. He’s gorgeous, dominant, frustrating, and dangerous.
You want to send him away for good. Stand your ground, but he’s so hard to resist.
But if he finds out about his daughter, there is going to be hell to pay.
  And Steve always collects.

He jogs up the front steps of the porch, knocking on the door. She pulls the door open, her hair rumbled with sleep, a little tank top and sleep shorts on. She squints in the bright light, trying to fix her hair.

“You’re early.” Y/N squeaks bashful.

“Nothing I haven’t seen before Doll.” He chuckles.

“Ugh, still.” She turns walking away leaving him to follow. He pushes the door closed behind him, watching her shuffle through the house.

“Where are your keys?” He looks on the table by the door.

“Why?” She calls, he could smell coffee.

“Cough them up.” He chuckles.

“What do you want with my car?” She squints at him as she peeks around the opening to the kitchen.

“I’m having it fixed nosey.” He chuckles softly.

“What? How? Why? I didn’t ask you to do that.” She stares at him in shock.

“Because you raised our daughter on your own for three years and this is only the start of what I owe you, so give up the keys, babe.” He smirks at her.

“I’m not sure where they are.” She scratches the side of her head a little ashamed.

“Man, somethings just don’t change.” He shakes his head, setting about to find the keys.

“Hey.” She points at him, he laughs. “I might have left them on my dresser.” She groans.

He waves her off and jogs up the stairs towards the master bedroom. He pushes open the door, he looks around from the dresser by the door, that used to house his things, it sat empty now. He moves to the night stands, only one side of her bed unmade. Nothing on the other side he used to occupy, except a box in the open slot under the table top. His fingers pull it out, a condom box.

Jealousy and anger bubbled in his chest, even though he knew he had no right. Was he stepping in on something? He never saw her with anyone else. She kissed him last night. He shakes his head, it doesn’t matter, this was his family, who ever this guy was he was gone. Y/N and Aria were his and he would make sure it was that way before this guy came sniffing around again.

“Hey I found,” she stops behind him “them.” She finishes slowly.

“Am I stepping in on something?” He drops the box on the nightstand top.

“No.” She shakes her head, blinking bright eyes at him.

“You sure?” He tips his head.

“I have a friend?” She shrugs, sounding unsure. “Once in a while we sleep together. He’s never met Ari, he’s never met mom, dad would hate him. He called the other day and wanted to get together.” She waves her hand.

“Get together?” Steve’s brow snaps up, scuffing at the words. Sure, he’d slept with other woman, but he never stuck to one. He used them to get off, but every time he was inside someone else he could only picture Y/N’s face.

“Oh don’t judge me Steven. I’m sure you’ve been real chaste since you bailed on me.” She rolls her eyes at him.

“He’s never met Ari?” He mutters, his jaw clenched, the idea of another man around his daughter lights something deep and dark in his chest.

“No, god you idiot. I didn’t just introduce her to an Tom, Dick and Henry I slept with.” You flicks him in the neck.

“Been that many?” He smirks at her.

“I hate you.” She throws her hands up.

“I hate him.” He turns picking up the box and throwing it in the little trash bin next to the dresser.

“Yeah well I’m sure he hates you too.” She rolls her eyes again.

“Why’s that?” He smirks.

“Because you’re the reason I’ve never had anything serious more than a date, literally they never get past the first date, and why I settled with a fuck buddy. No feelings, no strings, no way to hurt me.” She waves him off.

“You know what this means Y/N.” His voice set, deep and serious.

“What?” She mutters refusing to look up at him. His fingers grip her jaw, not harsh, just enough to get her to look up.

“I find him here. I find him near you. I’ll kill him.” His brows lifted, as he stares down at her. She gives a half nod, blinking in surprise. He leans in placing a chaste kiss on her lips. He takes the keys from her hand, heading for the door. “Get dressed and maybe I’ll take you for ice cream while we study.” He smirks at her. Her mouth smooshed together as if she was pouting. “And if you need a fuck buddy, we can add that to the list of things we need to discuss.” He winks and walks out.

“I hate you.” She calls after him.

“I know.” He calls back jogging back down the stairs.

“Things all good?” Sam and Peter chuckle, leaning on the porch.

“Yeah, Peter you grew up here. Any secluded area?” He smirks slapping the keys to Y/N’s car into Sam’s hand.

“Yeah a few miles out of town.” Peter chuckles.

“What did you kill her?” Sam snorts.

“No his ego is just massive and he’s a one possessive ass.” Y/N adds from the doorway. The three of them turn looking at her. She’s dressed in a little teal colored sundress, that hangs off her frame and stops around her thighs.

“I don’t share what’s mine.” He shrugs.

“So many things I could say right now.” She glares at him.

“Aren’t you supposed to be studying?” He cocks his eyebrow at her.

“Mom called. She said she’s making brunch, and Ari asked if you were coming over again.” She smirks.

“Really? She asked about me?” He breaks into a massive grin, he was a pussy ass softy when it came to Ari and Y/N.

“Yes wanted to know if you would come over, apparently she’s been talking to Nana none stop about you.” She looks almost smug.

“We’ll take my truck.” He grins.

“If you plan for ice cream later, you have to take Ari this time or you’ll never hear the end of it.” She shrugs. “You’ll need the car seat out of my Four Runner.” She tips her head.

“Not to be nosey, but who is Ari?” Sam lifts his hand looking around.

“Steve’s daughter.” Y/N smirks.

“AYYYY!” Peter and Sam cheer at the same time, making Y/N laugh. They pat Steve on the back, congratulating him.

“I’ll get the car seat, you get those cards, you’re studying today.” He points at her, she rolls her eyes and disappears into the house.

Pairing: Steve Rogers x Reader

Warnings: Language. Lies. Friends with Benefits. Possessiveness. Fights. Kidnapping. Small amount of violence.

   He left to find himself. Too young and dumb to stay and stick through it.
He took your happiness with, but left you something.
   The little girl you were growing.
He doesn’t know and you weren’t in a hurry to track down the man who broke your heart.
   You don’t need him.
Still don’t. The two of you are just fine.
That’s what you keep telling yourself, at least.
Till Steve Rogers comes barging back into your life.
Everything comes rushing back. He’s gorgeous, dominant, frustrating, and dangerous.
You want to send him away for good. Stand your ground, but he’s so hard to resist.
But if he finds out about his daughter, there is going to be hell to pay.
  And Steve always collects.

He jogs up the front steps of the porch, knocking on the door. She pulls the door open, her hair rumbled with sleep, a little tank top and sleep shorts on. She squints in the bright light, trying to fix her hair.

“You’re early.” Y/N squeaks bashful.

“Nothing I haven’t seen before Doll.” He chuckles.

“Ugh, still.” She turns walking away leaving him to follow. He pushes the door closed behind him, watching her shuffle through the house.

“Where are your keys?” He looks on the table by the door.

“Why?” She calls, he could smell coffee.

“Cough them up.” He chuckles.

“What do you want with my car?” She squints at him as she peeks around the opening to the kitchen.

“I’m having it fixed nosey.” He chuckles softly.

“What? How? Why? I didn’t ask you to do that.” She stares at him in shock.

“Because you raised our daughter on your own for three years and this is only the start of what I owe you, so give up the keys, babe.” He smirks at her.

“I’m not sure where they are.” She scratches the side of her head a little ashamed.

“Man, somethings just don’t change.” He shakes his head, setting about to find the keys.

“Hey.” She points at him, he laughs. “I might have left them on my dresser.” She groans.

He waves her off and jogs up the stairs towards the master bedroom. He pushes open the door, he looks around from the dresser by the door, that used to house his things, it sat empty now. He moves to the night stands, only one side of her bed unmade. Nothing on the other side he used to occupy, except a box in the open slot under the table top. His fingers pull it out, a condom box.

Jealousy and anger bubbled in his chest, even though he knew he had no right. Was he stepping in on something? He never saw her with anyone else. She kissed him last night. He shakes his head, it doesn’t matter, this was his family, who ever this guy was he was gone. Y/N and Aria were his and he would make sure it was that way before this guy came sniffing around again.

“Hey I found,” she stops behind him “them.” She finishes slowly.

“Am I stepping in on something?” He drops the box on the nightstand top.

“No.” She shakes her head, blinking bright eyes at him.

“You sure?” He tips his head.

“I have a friend?” She shrugs, sounding unsure. “Once in a while we sleep together. He’s never met Ari, he’s never met mom, dad would hate him. He called the other day and wanted to get together.” She waves her hand.

“Get together?” Steve’s brow snaps up, scuffing at the words. Sure, he’d slept with other woman, but he never stuck to one. He used them to get off, but every time he was inside someone else he could only picture Y/N’s face.

“Oh don’t judge me Steven. I’m sure you’ve been real chaste since you bailed on me.” She rolls her eyes at him.

“He’s never met Ari?” He mutters, his jaw clenched, the idea of another man around his daughter lights something deep and dark in his chest.

“No, god you idiot. I didn’t just introduce her to an Tom, Dick and Henry I slept with.” You flicks him in the neck.

“Been that many?” He smirks at her.

“I hate you.” She throws her hands up.

“I hate him.” He turns picking up the box and throwing it in the little trash bin next to the dresser.

“Yeah well I’m sure he hates you too.” She rolls her eyes again.

“Why’s that?” He smirks.

“Because you’re the reason I’ve never had anything serious more than a date, literally they never get past the first date, and why I settled with a fuck buddy. No feelings, no strings, no way to hurt me.” She waves him off.

“You know what this means Y/N.” His voice set, deep and serious.

“What?” She mutters refusing to look up at him. His fingers grip her jaw, not harsh, just enough to get her to look up.

“I find him here. I find him near you. I’ll kill him.” His brows lifted, as he stares down at her. She gives a half nod, blinking in surprise. He leans in placing a chaste kiss on her lips. He takes the keys from her hand, heading for the door. “Get dressed and maybe I’ll take you for ice cream while we study.” He smirks at her. Her mouth smooshed together as if she was pouting. “And if you need a fuck buddy, we can add that to the list of things we need to discuss.” He winks and walks out.

“I hate you.” She calls after him.

“I know.” He calls back jogging back down the stairs.

“Things all good?” Sam and Peter chuckle, leaning on the porch.

“Yeah, Peter you grew up here. Any secluded area?” He smirks slapping the keys to Y/N’s car into Sam’s hand.

“Yeah a few miles out of town.” Peter chuckles.

“What did you kill her?” Sam snorts.

“No his ego is just massive and he’s a one possessive ass.” Y/N adds from the doorway. The three of them turn looking at her. She’s dressed in a little teal colored sundress, that hangs off her frame and stops around her thighs.

“I don’t share what’s mine.” He shrugs.

“So many things I could say right now.” She glares at him.

“Aren’t you supposed to be studying?” He cocks his eyebrow at her.

“Mom called. She said she’s making brunch, and Ari asked if you were coming over again.” She smirks.

“Really? She asked about me?” He breaks into a massive grin, he was a pussy ass softy when it came to Ari and Y/N.

“Yes wanted to know if you would come over, apparently she’s been talking to Nana none stop about you.” She looks almost smug.

“We’ll take my truck.” He grins.

“If you plan for ice cream later, you have to take Ari this time or you’ll never hear the end of it.” She shrugs. “You’ll need the car seat out of my Four Runner.” She tips her head.

“Not to be nosey, but who is Ari?” Sam lifts his hand looking around.

“Steve’s daughter.” Y/N smirks.

“AYYYY!” Peter and Sam cheer at the same time, making Y/N laugh. They pat Steve on the back, congratulating him.

“I’ll get the car seat, you get those cards, you’re studying today.” He points at her, she rolls her eyes and disappears into the house.

body:
Jealous much?:Clint Barton imagine

Request: Hi could you please do 10 and 25 with Clint Barton? Thanks! 💞

Prompts: 10: “Wait a minute. Are you jealous?” 25:  “Have I entered an alternate universe or did you really just admit you like me?”

A/N: I’m actually pretty proud of this one. At first I had no idea what to do but it turned out good. I do wish I ended it better.

Masterlist: Here Prompts: Here

Characters: Clint, reader, and a girl bartender same Jackie.

Warning: Slight fighting, fluff, and of course I didn’t read over this

Y/N’s P.O.V:

Another absolutely beautiful night. I sat upon a window seat that outlooked the forest outside the Avengers tower. The rain hit the window in such calming patterns. It was nice to finally be home after a long mission.

A knock came across my door pulling my.out of my thoughts. I slowly trudged my way to the door and opened it. Behind the door stood Clint, he and I have been friends for a good amount of time.

“Hey, it seems that everyone else is busy. Wanna go to town and get a drink” I looked down to my clothes and back up. Clint was in a black button up and some nice jeans.

“I’d love to, but first I’ll need to change” Clint nodded and smiled.

“I’ll be in the living area” I closed the door and turned around. My closet was pretty decent in size, but I didn’t have very many clothing options.

Quickly I grabbed some jeans, a shirt, and a leather jacket. There wasn’t anything else I needed after changing, that’s until I passed the mirror. My hair was thrown around. I grabbed my brush and powered through the tangles and hurried out the door.

The halls were slightly dark from the storm. It was pretty peaceful. As I walked down the hall I looked through the room that I passed. Everyone was working at something, or sleeping.

As he said, Clint was down in the living area. He sat watching some boring show.

“Ready” Clint slightly jumped and turned.

“Yep” He stood and walked around the couch. We walked to the door and were met with a cash of lightning. He chuckled and held the door open.

“Thanks” He nodded and stepped out himself. As we walked I constantly looked up at the lightning and rain. Clint opened the door for me.

“Thanks” I chuckled again. He got in as I shut mine. It was a dark car, but it was simple. Clint started up the car and we began our journey to town.

About 30 minutes later we arrived into town. The whole ride consisted of us talking about the mission and things that we missed out on while we were gone. Once we arrive I quickly got out before he could open my door.

“That was my job” Clint walked around the car with his arms crossed.

“Well I took matters into my own hands” He jokingly rolled his eyes and walked towards the door. Of course he held it open for me. I stuck my tongue out and he just smiled.

The bar wasn’t too packed, just a few men and women conversing. Clint motioned for me to sit next to him at the bar.

“Two beers” He flagged down the bartender and she took notice. She passed us the drinks and leaned against the table.

“If.I’m not mistaken, you must be Hawkeye” She smiled a white grin and I sighed.

“Yes, I am” Clint took a swig if his beer and chuckled.

“I want to thank you for saving New York. It would have been much worse if you weren’t there” The lady walked away to take an order. Clint looked at me, I hadn’t noticed I had a disgusted look on my face.

“What?” I shook my head and looked away as she came back.

“By the way, my name’s Jackie” She stuck her hand out and waited for his.

“Clint” He responded while shaking her hand.

The night continued on with them talking. Do It drinks in and I began to realize how much I really liked him. I sighed and stood up. My balance was still decent. I walked out the door and into the pouring rain. Clint probably wouldn’t notice I was gone anyways.

After some time I heard a scoff. I turned my head to see Clint staring down at me. Standing up from the bench I fixed my wet hair and looked at him.

“What?” Clint shook his head and started walking off. I followed behind him slowly trying to avoid conversation. He got into the drivers side and I got in the passenger side. We sat for a few minutes in silent.

“Why did you walk out” He turned and looked at me as he said that.

“I didn’t want to interrupt your conversation with…Jackie” Clint rolled his eyes and laughed.

“Wowww. Really?” I looked at the ground and kept my eyes on my feet.

“Yes,She was all over you” He looked at me and rose a brow.

“Wait a minute. Are you jealous?” My face grew red as I looked at him.

“So what if I am. Ever since I moved here I’ve liked you. Is it a sin? I let my self fall for you even though I have no chance in hell.” Clint’s eyes widened and he began to laugh.

“Have I entered an alternate universe.or did you really just admit that you like me?” The car went silent and all that was heard was rain.

“Just- I- Stop asking questions” By now my face was bright red and I was regretting everything. He started up the car and we headed back.

Once we got back it was storming much harder. The two of us quickly got out of the car and ran up to the building. Before I opened the door Clint grabbed my arm. The sudden movement turned me around to face him. Clint leaned forward and his lips landed on mine. My heart began to beat really fast. My hand rested on his cheek as we backed out of the kiss.

“All you had to say was that you liked me and I would’ve considered that a date” We both chuckled. He dragged me inside the building and we sat on the couch watching movies all night.
